channel.title: Chat filter?
channel.description: Can someone please tell me how to make a chat filter so it **** bad words. I think it would be cool for my server to have.

item.title: Chat filter?
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

Fine ill make you one. Give me about 3 min. I’ll have it read from an array rather then a file.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 01, 2007, 10:23:02 PM[/size][hr]Here you go. I doubled posted so you would know i posted.

Change your appendPlayerChatText(stream str) { to this:

protected void appendPlayerChatText(stream str) { str.writeWordBigEndian(((chatTextColor&0xFF) << 8) + (chatTextEffects&0xFF)); str.writeByte(playerRights); str.writeByteC(chatTextSize); // no more than 256 bytes!!! String temp = misc.textUnpack(chatText, chatTextSize); String temp2 = censorStr(temp); misc.textPack(chatText, temp2); str.writeBytes_reverse(chatText, chatTextSize, 0); }

Add this String i made for you:

[code] String censorStr(String original) {
original.trim();
original.toLowerCase();
int z = 0;

String badWordAt[] = new String [1000];
//check if any bad word is in the array
while(badWords[z] != "endOfArray"){

int i = original.indexOf(badWords[z]);

if (badWords[z] == “endOfArray”){
return original;
}
if (i < 0) {
z++;
}else{

String partBefore = original.substring(0, i);
String partAfter  = original.substring(i + badWords[z].length());
String replacement = "";
for(int m =0; m > badWords[z].length(); m++){
	replacement = replacement+"*";
}
original = partBefore + replacement + partAfter;
z=0;
}

}[/code]

Here are the bad words in an array:

public String badWords[] = {"Shit","Fuck","ass","boobs","pussy","dick","cock","dildo","endOfArray"};

I just swore on mopar lol!
Here you go.

Woops! I just noticed a error. I fixed it.

Read full topic

item.title: Chat filter?
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

[quote=“Harleyscape owner, post:13, topic:129397”]1. Add these to player.java

[code]public String GenerateC(int length) {
String temp = “”;
for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
String te2 = temp;
temp = te2 + “*”;
}
return temp;
}

    public String censorStr(String str)
{
    String temp = str;
    try
    {
        BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("data/censor.txt"));
        String data = null;
        while ((data = in.readLine()) != null)
        {
                    String temp2 = data;
                    temp = temp.replaceAll(temp2, GenerateC(temp2.length()));
        }
    }
    catch (IOException e)
    {
        System.out.println("Critical error while checking is a censored word");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    return temp;

}[/code]2. And change your appendPlayerChatText to this

protected void appendPlayerChatText(stream str) { str.writeWordBigEndian(((chatTextColor&0xFF) << 8) + (chatTextEffects&0xFF)); str.writeByte(playerRights); str.writeByteC(chatTextSize); // no more than 256 bytes!!! String temp = misc.textUnpack(chatText, chatTextSize); String temp2 = censorStr(temp); misc.textPack(chatText, temp2); str.writeBytes_reverse(chatText, chatTextSize, 0); }

And then make file named “censor.txt” to data folder… And put words you want to censor to there.

REMEMBER THIS IS NOT MINE![/quote]
How about loading them into an array when the server starts up. What your doing is going to lag your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Chat filter?
item.dc:creator: @Harleyscape_owner Harleyscape owner
item.description:
@Harleyscape_owner wrote:

  1. Add these to player.java

[code]public String GenerateC(int length) {
String temp = “”;
for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
String te2 = temp;
temp = te2 + “*”;
}
return temp;
}

    public String censorStr(String str)
{
    String temp = str;
    try
    {
        BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("data/censor.txt"));
        String data = null;
        while ((data = in.readLine()) != null)
        {
                    String temp2 = data;
                    temp = temp.replaceAll(temp2, GenerateC(temp2.length()));
        }
    }
    catch (IOException e)
    {
        System.out.println("Critical error while checking is a censored word");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    return temp;

}[/code]2. And change your appendPlayerChatText to this

protected void appendPlayerChatText(stream str) { str.writeWordBigEndian(((chatTextColor&0xFF) << 8) + (chatTextEffects&0xFF)); str.writeByte(playerRights); str.writeByteC(chatTextSize); // no more than 256 bytes!!! String temp = misc.textUnpack(chatText, chatTextSize); String temp2 = censorStr(temp); misc.textPack(chatText, temp2); str.writeBytes_reverse(chatText, chatTextSize, 0); }

And then make file named “censor.txt” to data folder… And put words you want to censor to there.

REMEMBER THIS IS NOT MINE!

Read full topic
